snippet: The 2012 races in Texas proved that a losing candidate in one district can wind up with significantly more votes than winners in other areas, and it wasn’t just about the number of voters.
lead_paragraph: The 2012 races in Texas proved that a losing candidate in one district can wind up with significantly more votes than winners in other areas, and it wasn’t just about the number of voters.

headline.main: In Some Places, a Lot of Voters Aren’t Enough
headline.print_headline: In Some Places, a Lot of Voters Aren’t Enough
